column7: You are paying for the proximity to the park, apart from that, it's really not worth the money. Rooms are dated and not "that" Disney exciting. Our initial check in was terrible - was allocated a single double bed room despite booking a two double bed room, our first room smelt terrible and for the price was absolutely shocking. We complained to reception showing the confirmation of what we'd booked, and they did change it, but for what we paid no idea how this mistake was made. column7: Check in was slow to provide a room.  We arrived at 11am and the room was not ready until 3.20pm and that was only offered as we asked reception again.  The previous guests bottles were not removed from the room during the whole of our stay.  The tea for kettle was not replaced each day.  The plug in the bath did not work.  The air con would not go below 20 degrees.  The bathroom door squeaked and the framework was poorly maintained at floor level.  There were no facilities to have coffee or tea in the lobby whilst waiting for our taxi after check out.  We were unable to book any breakfasts during our stay and only one meal in the restaurant.

column6: We liked the overall experience at this hotel, it really added to the Disney magic. From driving through the gates, you were thrusted with scened surroundings. Walking through the lobby was a similar story, the staff in their adorning uniforms, the hotel decor and the room experience was all great and made the experience of staying in a Disney hotel so special.  Staff were helpful and friendly enough. Bar and Restaurant staff were attentive and chatty.  The grounds around the hotel were pristinely kept, and felt luxurious around the lake area.
column7: The free coffee machine on our floor wasn't stocked or maintained well, it was always out of milk or dirty from other users.  The food was average in the buffet, lots of choice but not as tasty and warm as you'd expect from a Disney hotel.  The room also had wallpaper coming off in the corner, and there was water damage to the ledge around the bath tub. I also included on the booking notes that this stay was to celebrate my birthday. I assumed some Disney magic would've been shared from the hotel staff when checking in or within our room, but there wasn't any. I'd assume customer satisfaction + price of the hotel would amount to a bit more effort.

But: at the arrival in the room the mirror was dirty - there were fingerprints all over; - the area around the toilet was yellow (from urine),  - the bathtub had a scratch in the paint and you could see the black material that is underneath the white cover. the scratch was about 6-7 cm and appeared really unkempt. - the free shower gel was half empty - was not replaced from the guests that stayed there before us. - the door frame in the room was broken in a corner and in order not to see the wood it was pinted over. PRO: The staff in the hall was very friendly, the breakfqst was good, but that is all that we have liked. The lack of cleanliness for a 4-star hotel who asks so higher prices is unjustified. The price asked ia waaaay to high for the services offered.

Overall, the hotel is a bit dated: furniture is wearer out, the ironing cloth has dozens of stains, the carpets on the hallways are worn out and the handrails need more than maintenance: they should be replaced entirely. Specifically, there were nails standing out from some decorations which fell off probably, making it rather dangerous for the children leaning on them.  The stairs at the entrance from the park side were sandy each day during our stay and this easily visible due to the stair lighting.

column7: 1. Is this a 4-5 star hotel? Nope. maybe 1 or 2 star. The facilities are old. It took them 3 hours to deliver my luggage! I called the reception many times but no one would answer your call!!! I still had to walk down to ask where the hell my luggages are because no one would answer the call and I was out of nappies. When I was finally at the luggage place they said someone already brought my luggage so I walked for nothing!!!! I wish someone answered their damn phone to let me know!!!! I don‚Äôt know maybe because of how big the hotel was and this is how long it would take to walk from the entrance to your room at the end of the hall. at a 4 star hotel when you arrive early and leave your luggage they would already have your luggage in my room when you arrive especially when we came back late like 9pm. the worst hotel to be honest and save your money and stay at a hotel in Val d‚ÄôEurope. 2. Th√© rooms smell. It‚Äôs probably because of how old this hotel is but you can smell a really bad body odour that is lingering in your room. I‚Äôm so glad I was only there for 2 nights. 3. room service will only give you 1 and half roll for 4 people and of course there is no such thing as room service at this hotel so make sure save your toilet roll! for 4 people we struggled! 4. if your not paying for compass club you won‚Äôt get breakfast and can‚Äôt get breakfast. so pay a few hundred of euros more to get treated a bit better, maybe it will be a 3 star experience. 5. check in will be long to prepare at least half your day doing this unless you have compas  club. 6. column7: 1- Upon arrival there is no Bellman service to help with our luggage (a single senior citizen with ladies and kids was a nightmare dragging luggage & strollers to and through security check then into hotel for check in then to the bar till rooms are ready then to our rooms!) Told this was available to Compass Club members only (hadn‚Äôt even heard of Compass Club till then) 2- Checked into our rooms at 4 pm! 3- We were starving by now but the bar lounge doesn‚Äôt serve food so went to the two available restaurants only to find that they shut from 1 till 6 pm ! Is this possible for any supposedly ‚Äúluxury‚Äù hospitality facility in the world to not have any outlet that serves food or snacks for the whole of the midday period , particularly a Disney resort that is mainly catering to kids ? 4- So having finally received our rooms at 4 pm and dragged all our luggage there , we resolved to calling room service as a last resort only to be blown away by their reply that they only provide room service to the 7th & 8th floor Compass Club !!! They only served us when I went ballistic and screamed my head off at them. Honestly, having stayed at top hotels the world over I have never felt as insulted staying at a $500+ room as at this hotel..basic services of Bellman and room service that are offered at 3 star hotels anywhere in the world are be touted as special services offered only to the elite Compass Club is pathetic! 5- There is no mini fridge in the room 6- TV remote not working had to call maintenance to change it 7- Kettle not working had to call maintenance to change it 8- A/C not working had to call maintenance to fix it  9- Variety and quality of room service food mediocre to say the very least  In short, we came here a long time ago with our daughter and had a great time, and we came back this time with our grandkids and now unfortunately don‚Äôt intend on coming back again

In most hotels they would even lend you one, all they did was give me directions to the nearest train station shop or mall!  I was only there for 3 nights!  The bed mattresses were horribly cheap, all the furniture was old and bashed in, there was no tea and coffee facilities - in your room - but a machine 2 corridors away with a credit limit for your room of 4 drinks!  For the whole time we were there the ice machine never worked once.  No room service, just a breakfast service for 38 euros per person or the hotel breakfast for euros 51 for an adult and one child, no flexibility, if your child is over 2 it can eat 2 thirds of an adult amount.  In all of the parks the food outlets are incredibly expensive and all the same offerings, just calling the outlet a different name!  Make the effort and go to Florida!

column7: Cozi interminabile peste tot, la receptie, la bagaje, la intrarea la masa! Un hotel de stat la coada! Am ajuns dimineata la ora 11, am stat la coada, am facut check-in fara acordarea de camera, domnul de la receptie ne-a dat cartele de acces in camera cu mentiunea ca pana la ora 15 vom primi nr de camera pe SMS. Nu am primit. Ne-am intors din parc la ora 19, era o coada interminabila la receptie. Am intrebat la ghiseul Informatii daca poata sa imi spuna numarul de camera. M-a trimis sa stau din nou la coada la Receptie. Pentru cina am facut rezervare la ora 21,30. Nu am putut intra, am asteptat inca o ora la doua cozi, una pentru verificarea certificatului verde ( desi mai fusesem odata verificati la intrarea in hotel! ) si inca o coada pentru a comanda si plati bauturile care nu intrau in pretul mesei. Apoi inca o coada de stat in picioare la usa restaurantului, ca sa se pregateasca o masa! A fost ciudat!

column6: Es ist ein tolles, nostalgisches, authentisches Hotel, ein absoluter Traum, trotz des Alters
column7: Es gibt keine Minibar, das muss auch nicht sein.  Auch kein Zimmerservice, nur f√ºr das Fr√ºhst√ºck am Morgen. Man konnte nicht einmal Wasser bestellen. Es gibt mehrere Restaurants im Hotel, dort haben wir dann eine halbe Liter Flasche f√ºr 4 Euro gekauft. Im Disney Village auch √ºberteuert zu dem gleichen Preis. Das ist wirklich nicht in Ordnung, f√ºr so was essentielles soviel Geld zu verlangen..

column6: Dat de kamer rustig lag.

column6: Heel leuke ervaring met vriendelijk personeel. Prachtig hotel op vlak van receptie etc en mooie ligging.
column7: Vrij basic kamer op zich, zeker gezien de prijs, maar wel helemaal in orde.

column6: Het hotel ligt op een prima plek, vlakbij Disney Village. Aan de buitenkant (van veraf) lijkt het allemaal prachtig! Als je dichterbij komt zie je pas hoe slecht onderhouden het hotel is! (Afgebladderde verf) jammer!
column7: Wij kregen een upgrade omdat wij na de overnachting nog 3 dagen via Disney een arrangement hadden in een Lakesite Superior kamer...nou ja een update? Wat een waardeloze kamer zeg! Klein, twee tweepersoonsbedden in een klein hok (zelfs de kamers in Santa Fe zijn nog groter!) de douche/bad was verstopt, kwamen haren van anderen omhoog drijven! De douchekraan gaf of bloedheet of ijskoud water! De bedden zijn niet echt comfortabel en het bijgekochte ontbijt is om te huilen! En dat voor zo ontzettend veel geld! Het is vergane glorie! Heel erg jammer. Eens maar nooit weer naar dit hotel.

column6: Tolle Lage direkt am Rande der Parks, riesiges Hotel. Kostenloser Parkplatz!
column7: Unser erster Eindruck waren leider die sehr unfreundlichen Security-Mitarbeiter vor dem Hotel, die uns lautstark dazu aufforderten, unser Gep√§ck durchleuchten zu lassen. Klar geht Sicherheit vor, aber so stellt man sich die Begr√º√üung am ‚ÄûHappiest place on Earth‚Äú nicht vor.

column6: op de kamer waren de bedden het best, bonus zijn de tissues het personeel is vriendelijk, alleen jammer dat ze soms te stil praten ( voor hardhorigen ) en niemand Nederlands spreekt het ontbijt is correct, maar voor die prijs toch maar matig : geen eieren a la carte , geen kok die eieren of pannenkoeken of ... bereidt, keuze is al bij al beperkt ; een viersterrenontbijt voor een vijfsterrenprijs ; men had beter een onderscheid gemaakt van leeftijdcategories, voor kinderen van 6-7 jaar superduur ; geldt trouwens niet enkel voor ontbijt, ook alle andere restaurants van Newton Bay zijn voor kinderen veel te duur ( neem een voorbeeld aan de VS : daar betalen kinderen maximaal 50%  van de volwassenen )    de shuttle is prima
column7: de prijzen, vooral voor kinderen in het park wordt veel te veel volk toegelaten, zeker op maandag was het zeer lang aanschuiven om binnen te geraken, ondanks dat iedereen zijn tickets bijhad gevolg: ook aan ALLE attracties was het zeer lang aanschuiven ( enkele attracties gesloten ), jonge kinderen kunnen geen drie kwartier aanschuiven in een saai parcours, zonder hen te animeren ( met Disney channels of Disney figuren ?!)  Waar niet moet gewacht worden zijn de icecream- en frisdrankstalletjes, en die zijn dan (weer) superduur... Onze kamer was het verst verwijderd van de liften, zeer onpractisch; liften zouden veel meer moeten verspreid zijn, dan wandel je meer langs winkeltjes ipv saaie en eindeloze gangen vol met deuren met bordjes "niet storen"... tja als er honderd man voorbij je deur moet ?  Elke keer met rugzak door de scanner , al is het vier keer daags , erger als op het vliegveld...

Es hie√ü man k√∂nne das Gep√§ck abgeben und man w√ºrde eine SMS mit der Zimmernummer erhalten, sobald dieses fertig sei (Zimmerkarten gab es sofort, aber ohne Programmierung). Eine solche SMS kam weder bei uns, noch bei anderen an. Wir mussten uns also am Abend erneut zum Check-In anstellen, wobei die Schlange noch l√§nger als Mittags war. Als wir endlich das zweite mal am Schalter waren, mussten wir an diesem noch immer 15min warten bis uns endlich ein Zimmer gegeben werden konnte. Als ich dann nach dem Gep√§ck fragte, verschwand die Dame an der Rezeption erneut im Hinterzimmer um den Verbleib des Gep√§cks herauszufinden. Das wurde mir dann einfach in der Lobby gebracht und ich konnte alles selbst ins Zimmer bringen. Ich war jedoch froh, dass ich meinen zweiten Check-In am fr√ºhen Abend machte, denn nach Schlie√üung des Parks bildete sich eine endlose Schlange in der Lobby, die Wartezeiten von 3 Stunden und vielleicht mehr aufwies.  Um ca. 23 Uhr waren dann s√§mtliche Korridore √ºberf√ºllt mit Menschen, die kein Zimmer bekommen haben und auf dem Boden sa√üen oder sogar lagen (und das bei den Zimmerpreisen). Das Zimmer selbst war ok, aber f√ºr den Preis dennoch nicht angemessen. Insgesamt war auch zu wenig Disneyfeeling.

column7: Hatte eigentlich √ºber booking.com eine Halbpension gebucht, welche aber Vorort nicht akzeptiert wurde. ‚ÄûBooking.com bietet das von sich aus aus ohne Absprache mit uns‚Äú. Sollte dann f√ºr das Fr√ºhst√ºck morgens extra nochmal 28‚Ç¨ p.P. F√ºr das Fr√ºhst√ºck zahlen, welches nicht wie auf der Karte in einem der drei Restaurants stattfand, sondern in irgend einem sch√§bigen Kongress Zimmer. Man brachte uns dann einen Kaffe, 0,1l Apfel- oder Orangensaft und man durfte sich all-you-can-eat von Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffet bringen lassen. Haben einiges bestellt und fast alles liegen lassen. Absolut ungenie√übar. Mir war zwar klar, dass Fr√ºhst√ºck in Frankreich nichts besonderes ist, aber das R√ºhrei war buchst√§blich nur 2 sekunden in der Pfanne, die Bratkartoffeln nicht gebraten und der Bacon sah aus und schmeckte wie D√∂rrfleisch. Mal abgesehen davon, dass nichts davon den Hauch von Salz oder Pfeffer gesehen hat. Haben uns dann noch beim Starbucks im Disney-Village ein kleines Fr√ºhst√ºck geholt und das f√ºr den n√§chsten Tag auch so gemacht. F√ºr SO ein teures Hotel und das extra Zahlen vom Fr√ºhst√ºck kann man wohl mehr erwarten. Aber das Essen im Disneyland allgemein ist auch eine Zumutung.. Vorsicht ist geboten!

Es war ein tolles Erlebnis und daher werde ich es daher gerne weiterempfehlen
